LEGEND_DISTRIBUTION_CHART_TOOLTIP: Assets status in the selected networks.
ASSET_TREND_OVER_LAST_30_DAYS: Asset trend over the last 30 days
LEGEND_TREND_CHART_TOOLTIP: Evolution of the assets found in the networks in the last 30 days.

SET_NON_MANAGEABLE_ASSET_CONFIRMATION.TITLE: Set Unmanageable Status
SET_NON_MANAGEABLE_ASSET_CONFIRMATION.HELPER: Are you sure you want to change the status to "Unmanageable"?

SET_NON_MANAGED_ASSET_CONFIRMATION.TITLE: Set Unmanaged Status
SET_NON_MANAGED_ASSET_CONFIRMATION.HELPER: Are you sure you want to change the status to "Unmanaged"?

CHANGE_ASSET_STATUS.MESSAGE: The asset status has been successfully updated.
CHANGE_ASSET_STATUS.TITLE: Status Updated

NON_MANAGEABLE_TOOLTIP: Batuta cannot be installed on this host yet.
NON_MANAGED_TOOLTIP: Batuta is not installed on this host.
MANAGED_TOOLTIP: Batuta is installed on this host.

ASSET_DETAILS.SET_AS_NON_MANAGEABLE_DESCRIPTION: Change status to unmanageable if you are certain that Batuta will be never installed on this asset.
ASSET_DETAILS.SET_AS_NON_MANAGEABLE_INFO: If you change the status to unmanageable, Batuta will stop scanning this host whenever it is identified on scanned networks.
ASSET_DETAILS.SET_AS_NON_MANAGED_DESCRIPTION: You can always set the status back to non managed if you now know that Batuta is installable on this asset.

PASSIVE_SCAN_FORM.TITLE: Run configuration
PASSIVE_SCAN_FORM.SCAN_BATCH_SIZE_DESCRIPTION: Number of hosts scanned simultaneously per execution batch. Valid values between 100 and 500.
PASSIVE_SCAN_FORM.SCAN_GROUPS_DESCRIPTION: Some groups may contain the same host more than once, but Batuta detects this and ensures each host is scanned only once. Max of 20 groups
PASSIVE_SCAN_FORM.SCAN_INFO_1: If the interval is modified, the new value will take effect starting from the next automatic execution. To apply the change immediately, please run a manual execution.
PASSIVE_SCAN_FORM.SCAN_INFO_2: An execution runs the network scan command on all hosts from the selected groups. If the number of hosts exceeds the defined batch size, the scan will be performed in batches. Each batch will scan a subset of hosts equal to the batch size, with a 10-second interval between batches
PASSIVE_SCAN_FORM.MIN_BATCH_SIZE: Batch size must be greater than or equal to {{min}}
PASSIVE_SCAN_FORM.MAX_BATCH_SIZE: Batch size must be less than or equal to {{max}}
PASSIVE_SCAN_FORM.REQUIRED_GROUPS: You must select at least one group
PASSIVE_SCAN_FORM.SUCCESS_MESSAGE: The passive scan configuration has been successfully updated

ENABLE_SCAN_MSG: Passive scanning is currently inactive. To start the automatic process, click the switch. Once enabled, the next execution will be scheduled based on the last run and the current interval.
DISABLE_SCAN_MSG: Passive scan is currently active. To stop this automatic process, click the switch.
ENABLED_SCAN_MSG: The passive scan is now active. The system is listening to network traffic to detect new devices.
DISABLED_SCAN_MSG: The passive scan is now off. The system has stopped monitoring network traffic for new devices.
RUN_SCAN_MSG: The passive scan has started successfully. The system is now listening to network traffic to detect new devices.
DISABLE_MODAL_SCAN_MSG_1: Are you sure you want to disable passive scanning?
DISABLE_MODAL_SCAN_MSG_2: No automated scans will be run again until you manually enable the process.
ENABLE_MODAL_SCAN_MSG_1: Are you sure you want to enable passive scanning?
ENABLE_MODAL_SCAN_MSG_2: Once enabled, the process next execution will be scheduled based on the current time adding the setted interval.
RUN_SCAN_SUBTITLE_MODAL: Are you sure you want to run a passive scan now? The system will start listening to network traffic to detect new devices.
REMOVING_MANY_BODY_1: Are you sure you want to remove the selected networks?
REMOVING_MANY_BODY_2: Once they are deleted you will have to create them again.
PASSIVE_SCAN_STATUS_TOOLTIP: Passive scanning runs automatically according to the interval configured by the user to maintain up-to-date network visibility. It can be enabled or disabled at any time, depending on monitoring needs. On-demand manual scans are also available; these are limited to one execution every 5 minutes to ensure optimal performance across all hosts with Batuta installed.
LEGEND_TREND_CHART_EMPTY: There is no data to show in the chart
LEGEND_DISTRIBUTION_CHART_EMPTY: There is no data to show in the chart

DELETE_NETWORK_CONFIGURATION_CONFIRMATIO.MESSAGE_2: Once it is deleted you will have to create it again

NETWORK_CONFIGURATION_FORM.NAME: Network Name
NETWORK_CONFIGURATION_FORM.RANGE_HELPER_TEXT: Enter the network range in CIDR notation (e.g., 192.168.0.0/24). The number after the slash represents the subnet mask and defines how many IPs are included in the scan.
NETWORK_CONFIGURATION_FORM.IP_RANGE_NOT_VALID: The IP range is not valid
